text:
This happened last night
This is the most important news from night to Monday November 4th.
04 Nov 2019, 05:17 by NTB



ğŸ“· Illustrative photo: HÃ¥kon Mosvold Larsen / NTB scanpix Gallery



ğŸ“· Illustrative photo: Gorm Kallestad / NTB scanpix Gallery



ğŸ“· Photo: Eraldo Peres / AP / NTB scanpix Gallery



ğŸ“· Photo: Christian Monterrosa / AP / NTB scanpix Gallery



ğŸ“· Stock Photo: Jerome Delay / AP / NTB scanpix Gallery


79-year-old died in snowmobile accident in Kautokeino
Just before midnight on Sunday, Finnmark police found a man searching the Kautokeino River. At 2.30am, police confirm that a missing 79-year-old has been found dead after driving a snowmobile through the ice.
In the exploration action, it was the scooter trail that led out onto the river, where the emergency services found a predator and saw the person in the river.
Proposes basic interest tax for the aquaculture industry
The government-appointed tax committee proposes introducing basic interest taxation for the Norwegian aquaculture industry, writes Fiskeribladet. It provokes the salmon industry.
The Aquaculture Tax Committee was appointed last September and is chaired by Karen Helene Ulltveit-Moe.
More oil is expected on Brazil's beaches
Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro said Sunday that the worst part of the oil spill that has hit the country's beaches has not yet reached land.
Over the past three months, oil has washed up on the beaches over a stretch of 2,000 kilometers of Brazil's coastline.
Trump threatens California
President Donald Trump threatens to withhold emergency relief to fire-stricken California because the state's Democratic governor has criticized his environmental policies.
Trump has repeatedly criticized Governor Gavin Newsom for his efforts to avoid the fires. Newsom expresses frustration that the president is no longer doing anything to combat climate change.
Famous Ebola fighter killed in Congo
A radio host, known for reporting the Ebola disease, has been killed in his home in Congo, the country's army said on Sunday.
The 35-year-old journalist Papy Mumbere Mahamba was killed in an attack by unknowns in the city of Lwemba. The journalist's wife was injured and their house was set on fire. The perpetrators fled the place.
